Class Pawn

java.lang.Object
engine.forPiece.Piece
engine.forPiece.Pawn
public final class Pawn extends Piece
The Pawn class represents a pawn chess piece with its unique movement and capture rules. Pawns can move forward one square, move forward two squares on their first move, capture diagonally, perform en passant captures, and promote to other pieces upon reaching the opponent's back rank. This class extends the Piece class and implements all pawn-specific behaviors including promotion to queen, rook, bishop, or knight pieces.

Pawn promotion is handled by generating all possible promotion moves when a pawn reaches the promotion square, allowing the chess engine to evaluate all promotion options.

Author:
Aaron Ho, dareTo81

      public Pawn(Alliance allegiance, int piecePosition, int numMoves)
      Constructs a new Pawn instance with the specified alliance and position.
      Parameters:
      allegiance - The alliance (color) of the pawn.
      piecePosition - The current position of the pawn on the board.
      numMoves - The number of moves made by the pawn.

      Parameters:
      alliance - The alliance (color) of the pawn.
      piecePosition - The current position of the pawn on the board.
      isFirstMove - Whether this is the pawn's first move.
      numMoves - The number of moves made by the pawn.

  • Method Details

    • locationBonus

      public int locationBonus(Board board)
      Calculates the positional bonus for this pawn based on its current board position. The bonus value is determined by alliance-specific pawn position tables that favor advanced and central pawn positions.
      Specified by:
      locationBonus in class Piece
      Parameters:
      board - The current chess board.
      Returns:
      The positional bonus value for this pawn's position.

    • calculateLegalMoves

      public Collection<Move> calculateLegalMoves(Board board)
      Calculates all legal moves for this pawn on the given board, including standard moves, two-square initial moves, diagonal captures, en passant captures, and promotion moves. Returns all possible moves that can be legally executed from the current position.
      Specified by:
      calculateLegalMoves in class Piece
      Parameters:
      board - The current chess board.
      Returns:
      A collection of legal moves for this pawn.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns the string representation of this pawn piece.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      The string representation of the pawn piece type.

    • movePiece

      public Pawn movePiece(Move move)
      Creates a new Pawn instance representing this pawn after the specified move is executed. The new pawn will be positioned at the move's destination coordinate.
      Specified by:
      movePiece in class Piece
      Parameters:
      move - The move to be executed.
      Returns:
      A new Pawn instance at the destination position.
